snippet: In a discussion at The New York Times, the president-elect was less adamant on prosecuting Hillary Clinton, the use of waterboarding and climate change....
abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump, during hourlong interview at New York Times, softens some of more extreme views espoused during campaign, but continues to flout some ethical and political conventions of American presidency; asserts he has no legal obligation to separate his business interests from presidency and defends strategist Stephen Bannon against charges of racism; appears to soften positions on torture and climate change.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR, JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: In a discussion at The New York Times, the president-elect was less adamant on prosecuting Hillary Clinton, the use of waterboarding and climate change.

headline.main: Trump, in Interview, Moderates Views but Defies Conventions
headline.print_headline: Trump Pulls Back but Still Defies the Conventions
